titleStmt.title: The city and country's loyalty; or, The gallant resolution of the kingdom to defend the same against the invasion of the French, voluntarily engaging thmeselves [sic] in the defence of King William Queen and [sic] Mary. To the tune of, Valiant Jockey, &c.

The city and country's loyalty; or, The gallant resolution of the kingdom to defend the same against the invasion of the French, voluntarily engaging thmeselves [sic] in the defence of King William Queen and [sic] Mary. To the tune of, Valiant Jockey, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for C. Bates, next door to the Crown-Tavern, at Duck Lane-end, in West-Smithfield.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "Let the trumpets sound a charge ..."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.

person.persName: C. Bates, next door to the Crown-Tavern
